text: Dermochrosia is a monotypic genus of Brazilian huntsman spiders containing the single species, Dermochrosia maculatissima. It was first described by Cândido Firmino de Mello-Leitão in 1940, and is found in Brazil. ==See also== * List of Sparassidae species ==References== Category:Monotypic Araneomorphae genera Category:Sparassidae Category:Spiders of Brazil Category:Taxa named by Cândido Firmino de Mello-Leitão
title: Dermochrosia
